dt: {bc}any of several semiarboreal slender-bodied carnivorous mammals (genus {it}Martes{/it}) of the weasel family that occur in the northern hemisphere
{bc}the fur or pelt of a marten

et: Middle English {it}martryn{/it}, from Anglo-French {it}martrine{/it} marten fur, from Old French {it}martre{/it} marten, of Germanic origin; akin to Old English {it}mearth{/it} marten
shortdef: any of several semiarboreal slender-bodied carnivorous mammals (genus Martes) of the weasel family that occur in the northern hemisphere
the fur or pelt of a marten

dt: {bc}the pelt or fur of the European marten ({it}Martes martes{/it})

et: partial translation of German {it}Baummarder{/it}, from {it}Baum{/it} tree + {it}Marder{/it} marten
shortdef: the pelt or fur of the European marten (Martes martes)

dt: {bc}an American marten ({it}Martes americana{/it}) found mainly in coniferous forests

shortdef: an American marten (Martes americana) found mainly in coniferous forests; also : a Eurasian marten (Martes martes)
